intro: Tinus insularis, commonly known as the island tinus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the island's humid forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
